title: Unit tests fail on Travis with Python 2.6
body:
Unit tests with Python 2.6 started failing regularly on Travis since November 8th. See also #9776 

### Steps to reproduce the issue
Recently, any PR will fail the python 2.6 unit tests. The last time python 2.6 tests worked seems [this one](https://travis-ci.org/spack/spack/builds/452605915), while one of the first failures happened [on a previous build](https://travis-ci.org/spack/spack/builds/452293621) with the same commit hash. This suggests the failures are not due to bugs that sneaked in with new features or recent merges.

### Error Message

What can be seen is that Spack hangs when trying to concretize `mpileaks`:
```console
...
more help:
  spack help --all       list all commands and options
  spack help <command>   help on a specific command
  spack help --spec      help on the spec syntax
  spack docs             open http://spack.rtfd.io/ in a browser
Input spec
--------------------------------
mpileaks%gcc
    ^elfutils@0.170
Concretized
--------------------------------
No output has been received in the last 10m0s, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.
Check the details on how to adjust your build configuration on: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#Build-times-out-because-no-output-was-received
The build has been terminated
...
```
